meanings.definition: In a manner that is tedious and exhausting
meanings.sent1: She worked grindingly on her homework until late at night.
meanings.sent2: The old man walked grindingly up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The cat watched grindingly as the mouse ran in circles.
meanings.sent4: Time moved grindingly slow as she waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the clock ticking was grindingly loud in the silent room.

meanings.definition: In a way that causes friction or abrasion
meanings.sent1: The metal pieces rubbed grindingly against each other.
meanings.sent2: The rough sandpaper moved grindingly against the wood.
meanings.sent3: The car's brakes screeched grindingly as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent4: His shoes squeaked grindingly on the polished floor.
meanings.sent5: The constant rubbing made the door creak grindingly every time it opened.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is slow and laborious
meanings.sent1: The turtle moved grindingly across the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: The old printer worked grindingly to produce each page.
meanings.sent3: The snail inched grindingly towards the lettuce leaf.
meanings.sent4: The gears turned grindingly as the machine struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed grindingly through the rocky terrain.
